title: "Runes Reforged lets you create whole new playstyles" - Riot video

replies.body: The end idea might be the same, but you have different paths you can choose to get there. The videos would've been much better if they showed 2 builds per video demonstrating how people can have _choices_ on how to play champions now.

My point still stands, they could have put more effort in. Also, there are options that genuinely change a lot about how a champion works. My friend has a specific setup he's been using on Tahm Kench on the PBE that makes him able to go almost 700 movespeed when he eats someone using ghost. I've seen him eat people halfway down the lane and spit them out behind his tower. That's the type of thing these videos should be showcasing.
Yeah I agree, for how cool the new runes are they made a pretty boring series of videos.
The videos were fine. You are just being whiny here. Sure they could have had "more", but they could have done nothing. Some of you kids are just always going to complain.

It isn't about more or less. They missed the point of their own video, which makes it boring. If they had just shown something cool like the slow resist Tahm Kench mentioned above it would've caught people's attention. Instead we got TF with a 10-20 second lower cd ult and a burst of movespeed WOWZERS that really gets my creative juices flowing. 

Shoot the builds they showed didn't even have to be optimal (Predator TF for early gold card cheese ganks, dark harvest Nasus for 1 shot potential), just showcase the fact that champions can have diverse playstyles now.
I feel like the new rune system (like so many things in this game) heavily favours ADCs...

Not specificly adcs, more like just ranged auto attackers in general

why not ranged as a whole?? Because a lot of mages dont seem to use the new runes as well as ad champs do.  But all in all ranged champs again won the power battle.  Just look at Riots video.  "Gnar gets the dueling potential of frozen mallet without the huge investment."   WTF

Hi guys,

Our goal for these videos was to show potentially non-standard builds for champions that could achieve each champions specific "dream scenario."  They were not necessarily trying for something they wouldn't as a champion conceptually try to do.

For some champions (Eve), the builds may end up being an optimal build (we aren't totally sure). For other champions we picked builds that most people wouldn't think of (Tank Bard, Phase Rush Nasus), but could still be viable.

So while I agree these are not "wacky" builds, they show a variety of gameplay options that is just the tip of the iceberg of whats possible this Preseason.

That's the funny thing about Nasus. People took Stormraiders on Nasus because they wanted the 5% CDR mastery, not necessarily because Stormraiders was the optimal keystone for him. Having early CDR and a 45% CDR cap are extremely important on Nasus, so you couldn't afford taking Grasp for lane sustain and less disadvantageous trades because it hindered his ability to Q stack into late game.

Phase Rush might still be dominant on Nasus because that's where the delayed 10% CDR rune is, but I personally am looking forward to trying out Arcane Comet Nasus and harassing my lane opponent with Wither. XD

I see your point, but in reality the old rune system didn't offer much real variety. You had the same setup you used for X champion in 90% of situations. I think this one is an improvement, but it's not without flaws of its own.

Yeah, you'd normally go the same mastery page every single game regardless of matchups. Runes were the thing that you wanted to change based on the enemy team but you couldn't alter them in champ select.

This new system is no different. Most champions are going to be pigeon holed into a certain build path no matter what based on their scaling or kits. This isn't new, it's really just more of the same with far fewer choices. In the old System I would always have similar Builds between champions but I could have one with CDR, AS, Health and MR/Armor. I could also have pages with lethality or AD. There is no way to mix and match all these options anymore. This is far more restrictive and binary than what we just had.

See? I can summarize and give it a negative undertone aswell. The videos explain how the runes synergyze and **amplify** these champions' playstyles.

The argument is they say "create new playstyles" then show us champs doing the same playstyle they've been doing since before the new runes.

It isn't just about being a negative nancy.

Then don't lead every video with literally these exact words: "Runes reforged lets you customize your champion to **create whole new playstyles**"

If you're gonna try to summarize a post, try to actually understand what it's saying.
I admit failing there but my point still stands. Your thread makes it look like you dislike the videos in general.
My thread makes it look like I dislike the videos because I do in fact dislike the videos.

These new changes are the worst thing to happen to league. You get only two sets of mastery/runes without being able to change the garbage standard setups, TWO! And I used to complain that 20 mastery pages was too few! Come on now, there are well over 100 champions in this damn game. Now, you simply cannot be flexible with a wide champion pool without dumping tons of money into pages. I unlocked and bought these champions, I want to be able to play them without being crippled with so few preset options. Seriously, I paid enough time and money into the game already, I'm not buying your dumb pages. With the general public only having so many presets, if they don't get their choice in lane/champ (blind pick, or bans), they are astronomically more likely to flame, intentionally feed, poorly perform--basically ruin your team's game experience. All your collective success in improving community with honor ratings... say goodbye to that. Let's not throw the game into imbalanced chaos for 2 months while losing players to the stupidity of having to completely relearn the game. You have, sorry HAD, an amazing game for years. For the love of God, why would you want completely change it so much!? I understand that pre-season changes are typically big ones, but this is purely a money grab tilting the game towards pay to win (more pages => more champions you can actually use successfully to counterpick with).
I have four and I'm able to edit my two main ones on the fly for different matchups in the lanes/champions I have them set up for and have the two others for champions or roles I don't get often.

The pages you have are based on the runepages you had before.

The difference is that you can edit the new runes like you did with Masteries in champ select, so you technically don't NEED more pages, you WANT them because you don't want to change those in select and have preset pages.

If you don't want to waste BE/RP and you aren't lazy, you don't need more pages.
